item.title: 美国能源部称，委内瑞拉石油销售所得资金将存入美国控制的银行账户
item.description: 美国能源部周三发表声明称，美国已开始销售委内瑞拉石油，其销售所得款项将首先存入美国在全球知名银行控制的账户中。【原文：The U.S. has begun marketing Venezuelan oil and all proceeds from its sale will initially settle in U.S.-controlled accounts at globally recognized banks, the Department of Energy said in a statement released on Wednesday.】

item.title: 票务巨头Ticketmaster寻求终结美国联邦贸易委员会的票务转售诉讼案
item.description: 票务巨头Ticketmaster正敦促洛杉矶联邦法官驳回美国联邦贸易委员会的指控。该机构被控与黄牛合作哄抬票价，但Ticketmaster辩称，其被指控违反的法律仅适用于票务转售商，而非票务平台本身。【原文：Ticketmaster is urging a federal judge in Los Angeles to throw out the U.S. Federal Trade Commission's case accusing it of working with resellers to gouge fans, saying the law it is accused of violating applies only to resellers, not ticketing platforms.】

item.title: MSCI将于2026年初在纽约证券交易所推出基准指数期权
item.description: 纽约证券交易所周三表示，其母公司旗下几家交易所将于今年年初承接美国MSCI基准指数期权上市业务，具体安排尚待监管机构批准。【原文：The NYSE said on Wednesday a couple of exchanges under its parent company would host U.S. options listings for several benchmark MSCI indexes early this year, subject to regulatory approval.】

item.title: 美乌基金推出潜在投资项目门户网站
item.description: 美国国际开发金融公司（DFC）周三开通了在线门户网站，供申请人向新设立的美国-乌克兰重建基金提交项目，并表示预计将在未来数月内宣布首批投资项目。【原文：The U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) on Wednesday launched an online portal for applicants to submit projects to a new U.S.-Ukraine reconstruction fund, saying it expected to announce first investments in coming months.】

item.title: 道琼斯与Polymarket达成协议，将在旗下媒体平台添加预测数据
item.description: 新闻集团旗下的道琼斯公司周三宣布，已与Polymarket达成独家协议，将为其旗下媒体平台——包括《华尔街日报》、《巴伦周刊》和MarketWatch——提供实时预测市场数据。【原文：News Corp's Dow Jones said on Wednesday it had signed an exclusive deal with Polymarket to bring real-time prediction market data to its outlets including The Wall Street Journal, Barron's and MarketWatch.】

item.title: 中国东风汽车正与土耳其商谈乘用车生产事宜，当地经销商透露
item.description: 东风汽车公司正在与一位投资者商谈在土耳其生产乘用车的事宜，该公司土耳其经销商表示。【原文：China's Dongfeng Motor is in talks with an investor about producing passenger cars in Turkey, the company's Turkish distributor said.】

item.title: 富国银行认为美国股市涨势将扩大，因投资者正从巨型股转向其他板块
item.description: 富国银行策略师表示，得益于家庭退税和企业盈利增长强劲，2026年上半年美国股市可能实现超越其常规巨型股领头羊的反弹。【原文：U.S. equities could rally beyond their usual mega-cap leaders in the first half of 2026, helped by tax refunds for households and stronger earnings growth among companies, Wells Fargo strategists said.】

item.title: 巴西审计法院院长称只有最高法院才能推翻 Banco Master 的决定
item.description: 巴西联邦审计法院院长维塔-多-雷戈（Vital do Rego）法官周三表示，该法院无权推翻央行清算贷款机构 Banco Master 的决定，并需要更多时间来评估清算是否合理。【原文：Brazil's federal audit court does not have authority to reverse a central bank decision to liquidate lender Banco Master and needs more time to assess whether the liquidation is justified, the court's head Judge Vital do Rego said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英国数据监督机构就 Grok 人工智能图像与马斯克的 X 公司取得联系
item.description: 英国数据监管机构信息专员办公室（Information Commissioner's Office）周三表示，鉴于人们对使用 X 的内置人工智能机器人 Grok 制作图像的担忧，该机构已要求埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司澄清其如何遵守数据保护法。【原文：Britain's data regulator, the Information Commissioner's Office, said on Wednesday it had asked Elon Musk's X to clarify how it was complying with data protection laws in light of concerns about the use of X's built-in AI bot Grok to produce images.】

item.title: 高盛称，对冲基金将在 2025 年借助股市上涨带来两位数收益
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）的一份报告显示，2025 年对冲基金取得了强劲的收益，因为大盘股指在年末接近创纪录的高点，而且市场勇敢地面对了美国贸易政策不确定性引发的波动。【原文：Hedge funds notched robust gains in 2025, as broader stock indexes ended the year near record highs and markets braved volatility triggered by uncertainty around U.S. trade policy, according to a Goldman Sachs report.】

item.title: 信息》报道：中国要求科技公司停止订购英伟达 H200 芯片
item.description: 据《信息时报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，中国政府已要求一些中国科技公司本周停止订购英伟达的H200芯片，并可能强制要求购买国产人工智能芯片。【原文：Beijing has asked some Chinese tech companies to halt orders for Nvidia's H200 chips this week and may mandate domestic AI chip purchases, the Information reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份工厂订单下降
item.description: 10 月份美国工厂产品的新订单有所下降，但第四季度初企业的设备支出仍保持稳定。【原文：New orders for U.S. factory goods fell in October, but business spending on equipment was solid early in the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 美国 11 月职位空缺降幅超过预期
item.description: 美国 11 月份的职位空缺降幅超过预期，而招聘则有所放缓，这表明在经济不确定的情况下，劳动力需求继续减弱。【原文：U.S. job openings fell more than expected in November while hiring eased, suggesting demand for labor continued to ebb amid economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 在创纪录的一年后，桥水任命资深投资者 Bob Prince 为董事会主席
item.description: 桥水联合公司（Bridgewater Associates）周三任命其首席投资官之一、从业四十年的资深人士鲍勃-普林斯（Bob Prince）为董事会主席，此前该对冲基金在 2025 年取得了丰厚的回报。【原文：Bridgewater Associates on Wednesday appointed Bob Prince, one of its chief investment officers and a veteran of four decades, as the chair of its board of directors after the hedge fund delivered blockbuster returns in 2025.】

item.title: 美国 12 月服务业活动回暖，就业率反弹
item.description: 美国服务业活动在 12 月份意外回升，表明 2025 年末经济基础稳固。【原文：The U.S. services sector activity unexpectedly picked up in December, suggesting the economy ended 2025 on a solid footing.】

item.title: ASML 称社交媒体黑客攻击指控不实
item.description: 荷兰计算机芯片设备供应商 ASML 周三表示，社交媒体上关于该公司遭到黑客攻击的说法不属实。【原文：Dutch computer chip equipment supplier ASML said on Wednesday that claims posted on social media that the company had been hacked were untrue.】

item.title: 雀巢婴儿配方奶粉召回范围扩大至中国和巴西
item.description: 雀巢公司的统计数字和国家卫生部的声明显示，雀巢召回部分批次婴儿营养品的范围已从欧洲扩大到美洲和亚洲，包括中国和巴西。【原文：Nestle's recall of some batches of infant nutrition products has widened beyond Europe to the Americas and Asia, including China and Brazil, a tally from the company and national health ministry statements show.】

item.title: Semafor 最新融资估值达 3.3 亿美元，助力全球扩张
item.description: Semafor 周三表示，该公司已经完成了一轮 3000 万美元的融资，融资后这家数字媒体初创公司的估值为 3.3 亿美元，这是该公司首次实现盈利。【原文：Semafor said on Wednesday it has closed a $30 million financing round, valuing the digital media startup at $330 million post-money, after its first profitable year.】

item.title: 美国 12 月私营部门就业人数不及预期
item.description: 尽管劳动力需求疲软导致就业增长明显放缓，但从历史标准来看，裁员人数仍然相对较少。【原文：Though job growth has slowed significantly amid weak demand for labor, layoffs remain relatively low by historical standards.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司向波音公司订购 110 架飞机
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Airlines）周三表示，将订购 105 架新的 737-10 型飞机和 5 架新的 787 型飞机，同时行使之前与波音公司签订的所有 787 型飞机期权。【原文：Alaska Airlines is ordering 105 new 737-10 and five new 787 aircraft, exercising all previous 787 options held with Boeing , the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，HSG 的延续基金将为 ByteDance 估值高达 3700 亿美元
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，风险投资公司 HSG（红杉资本中国基金的前身）正在募集一支延续基金，该基金将以 3,500 亿至 3,700 亿美元的估值接手字节跳动的部分股份。【原文：Venture capital firm HSG, formerly Sequoia Capital China, is raising a continuation fund that will take over some of its ByteDance shares at a valuation of between $350 billion and $370 billion, two people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司为扩张计划订购 110 架波音飞机
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Airlines）周三表示，该公司将订购 110 架新波音飞机，这是该公司历史上最大的一笔订单。【原文：Alaska Airlines is ordering 110 new Boeing planes, the largest single order in the airline's history, the carrier said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国表示需要无限期控制委内瑞拉石油销售以推动变革
item.description: 美国能源部长克里斯·赖特周三表示，美国需要无限期控制委内瑞拉的石油销售和收入，以推动该国实现美国期望的变革。【原文：The United States needs to control Venezuela's oil sales and revenue indefinitely to drive the changes it wants to see in the country, Energy Secretary Chris Wright said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Spotify 让创作者赚钱更容易，披露播客支出达 100 亿美元
item.description: Spotify 正在扩大其针对创作者的货币化计划，并为视频播客推出新的工具，目的是在蓬勃发展的市场上更好地与 YouTube 和 Netflix 竞争。【原文：Spotify is expanding its monetization program for creators and introducing new tools for video podcasters, as it aims to better compete with YouTube and Netflix in the booming market.】

item.title: CNBC 报道：委内瑞拉石油销售将无限期继续，制裁将减少
item.description: 美国有线电视新闻网（CNBC）周三援引接近白宫的消息人士的话报道称，委内瑞拉对美国的石油销售将无限期地继续下去，制裁也将减少。【原文：Oil sales from Venezuela to the United States will continue indefinitely and sanctions will be reduced, CNBC reported on Wednesday, citing sources close to the White House.】

item.title: 美国 12 月私营部门就业人数反弹不及预期
item.description: 经济学家表示，主要与进口关税有关的政策不确定性导致企业不愿增加员工人数。【原文：Economists say policy uncertainty mostly related to import tariffs has left businesses reluctant to increase their headcounts.】

item.title: 加拿大药房平台将向美国患者提供源自印度的 Ozempic
item.description: 在线药房平台SaveRxCanada.to周三表示，随着对廉价药物的需求增长，该公司已开始向美国患者提供诺和诺德公司从印度采购的糖尿病特效药Ozempic。【原文：Online pharmacy platform SaveRxCanada.to said on Wednesday it has begun offering Novo Nordisk's blockbuster diabetes drug, Ozempic, sourced from India to U.S. patients, as demand for cheaper options grows.】

item.title: Adobe 称，尽管增长放缓，美国在线假日消费仍创下历史新高
item.description: Adobe Analytics 公司周三发布的数据显示，2025 年美国在线假日消费增长放缓，尽管购物者在大幅折扣和更广泛地使用 "即买即付 "计划的支持下创下了新纪录。【原文：U.S. online holiday spending growth slowed in the 2025 season, Adobe Analytics data showed on Wednesday, even as shoppers set a record on the back of steep discounts and wider use of buy-now-pay-later plans.】

item.title: 美元前景疲软，美联储独立忧虑挥之不去
item.description: 接受路透社调查的货币策略师对 2026 年初美元的前景仍然看跌，预计到年底会有小幅下跌，原因是对美联储独立性和降息可能性的持续担忧。【原文：The outlook for the U.S. dollar among currency strategists polled by Reuters remains bearish at the start of 2026, with a modest decline expected by year-end based on persistent concerns around Federal Reserve independence and the possibility of lower interest rates.】

item.title: 美国银行以 "买入 "评级开始覆盖以色列顶级银行
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）周三开始对以色列四大银行进行评级，给予 "买入 "评级，称这些银行杠杆作用良好，有望从加沙战后的经济发展势头中获益。【原文：Bank of America on Wednesday initiated coverage of Israel's four largest banks with "buy" ratings, saying they are well leveraged and positioned to benefit from post-Gaza war economic momentum.】
